transcript:
Kutiizov's expectations that the proposals of capitulation (which were in no way binding) might give time for part of the transport to pass, and also that Murat's mistake would very soon be discovered, proved correct. As soon as Bonaparte (who was at Schonbrunn, sixteen miles from Hollabriinn) received Murat's dis- patch with the proposal of a truce and a capit- ulation, he detected a ruse and wrote the fol- lowing letter to Murat: 
Schonbrunn, 25th Brumaire, 1805, at eight o'clock in
